title: Te Petihana Reo Māori 1972
description: Kua whiwhi te petihana i ngā waitohu 30,000. Ko te take matua: me tiaki te Reo Māori. He wā tino whakahirahira tēnei mō te oranga o te reo.
description_en: A petition has gathered over 30,000 signatures. The main issue: Te Reo Māori must be protected. This is a critical moment for the survival of the language.

historical_context.significance: He petihana nui tēnei i tukuna ki te Pāremata e Hana Te Hemara. I whakaatu i te hiahia nui o te iwi kia tiakina te Reo Māori.

title: Te Ture o Waitangi 1975
description: Ka whakatūngia te Rōpū Whakamana i te Tiriti o Waitangi. Ka taea e rātou te whakarongo ki ngā kērēme mō ngā takahanga o te Tiriti.
description_en: The Waitangi Tribunal is being established. They will be able to hear claims about Treaty breaches.

historical_context.significance: I whakatūria te Rōpū Whakamana i te Tiriti o Waitangi hei whakarongo ki ngā kērēme. Ko tēnei te tūāpapa mō ngā kōrero mō te Reo Māori.

title: Te Kērēme WAI 11 - 1985
description: Kua tukuna te kērēme WAI 11 ki te Rōpū Whakamana. Ko te kī: kei te mate te Reo Māori, ā, he taonga tēnei e tiakina ana e te Tiriti o Waitangi.
description_en: The WAI 11 claim has been submitted to the Tribunal. The argument: Te Reo Māori is dying, and it is a treasure protected by the Treaty of Waitangi.

historical_context.significance: Ko WAI 11 te kērēme tuatahi mō te Reo Māori. I whakatakotoria e Huirangi Waikerepuru mā.

title: Te Pūrongo WAI 11 - 1986
description: Kua whakaputa te Rōpū Whakamana i tā rātou pūrongo. E kī ana rātou: me tautoko te Kāwanatanga i te Reo Māori, kia kaua e mate.
description_en: The Tribunal has released their report. They state: The Government must actively support Te Reo Māori to prevent its death.

historical_context.significance: I kī te pūrongo me whakatū he tari motuhake mō te Reo Māori, me te tautoko pūtea hoki.

title: Te Ture Reo Māori 1987
description: He wā nui tēnei! Ka taea te whakamana i te Reo Māori hei reo ōfihia o Aotearoa. He piki nui tēnei i te mana o te reo.
description_en: This is a major moment! Te Reo Māori can be made an official language of New Zealand. This would be a huge boost to the status of the language.

historical_context.significance: I meinga te Reo Māori hei reo ōfihia. I whakatūria hoki Te Taura Whiri i te Reo Māori (Te Reo Māori Commission).

title: Te Whakapūtanga o Matawaia 1988
description: Kua hui ngā rangatira Māori ki Matawaia. Kei te tohe rātou mō te mana motuhake o te reo, me te ako i ngā kura.
description_en: Māori leaders have gathered at Matawaia. They are advocating for language autonomy and teaching in schools.

historical_context.significance: I whakaputa te Whakapūtanga o Matawaia ngā tikanga matua mō te whakaora i te Reo Māori.

title: Te Ture Mātauranga 1989
description: Ko tēnei ture e whakarite ana i te ako i roto i ngā kura o Aotearoa. Ka taea te whakakaha i te Reo Māori i roto i te pūnaha mātauranga.
description_en: This act governs education in New Zealand schools. Te Reo Māori can be strengthened within the education system.

historical_context.significance: I whakarite te Education Act 1989 i te mana o ngā kura, tae atu ki ngā Kura Kaupapa Māori.

title: Te Ture Whakapai 1991
description: Ka taea te whakakaha ake i Te Taura Whiri i te Reo Māori. Me pēhea te whakarite i te tari kia kaha ake?
description_en: Te Taura Whiri i te Reo Māori can be strengthened. How should the commission be structured to be more effective?

historical_context.significance: I whakakaha te Amendment Act i te mana o Te Taura Whiri i te Reo Māori.

title: Te Māngai Pāho 1993
title_en: Broadcasting Funding Agency - Te Māngai Pāho 1993
description: Ka whakatūria he tari pūtea mō ngā kaupapa pāpāho Māori. Ka taea te tautoko i ngā whakaaturanga reo Māori i te reo irirangi me te pouaka whakaata.
description_en: A funding agency for Māori broadcasting will be established. Māori language content on radio and television can be supported.

historical_context.significance: I whakatūria Te Māngai Pāho hei tari pūtea mō ngā kaupapa pāpāho Māori.

title: Te Tau o te Reo Māori 1995
description: Kua whakataungia e Te Taura Whiri te tau 1995 ko Te Tau o te Reo Māori. He wā tēnei ki te whakanui me te whakatairanga i te reo.
description_en: Te Taura Whiri has declared 1995 as Māori Language Year. This is a time to celebrate and promote the language.

historical_context.significance: Ko te Tau o te Reo Māori i 1995 te tuatahi o ēnei momo kaupapa whakanui.

title: Te Ture Ratonga Pouaka Whakaata Māori 2003
description: Ka whakatūria tētahi rārangi pouaka whakaata motuhake mō te Reo Māori. Ko Māori Television tēnei. He piki nui i te tirohanga o te reo.
description_en: A dedicated television channel for Te Reo Māori will be established. This is Māori Television. A huge boost to the visibility of the language.

historical_context.significance: I whakatūria Māori Television hei rārangi pouaka whakaata mō te Reo Māori me ngā tikanga Māori.

title: Te Ture mō Te Takutai Moana 2011
description: Ko tēnei ture mō ngā taha moana me ngā takutai. Ka taea te whakauru i te Reo Māori ki ngā mahi whakahaere rohe.
description_en: This act is about the marine and coastal areas. Te Reo Māori can be integrated into regional management processes.

historical_context.significance: I whakarite te ture i ngā tikanga mō ngā takutai moana, me te whakauru i ngā tikanga Māori.

title: Te Ture mō Te Reo Māori 2016
title_en: Te Ture mō Te Reo Māori (Māori Language Act) 2016
description: He ture hou tēnei mō te Reo Māori. Ka whakatūria te mahi tahi o te Karauna me te iwi Māori. Ko te whāinga: kia ora tonu te reo.
description_en: This is a new act for Te Reo Māori. Shared governance between the Crown and Māori will be established. The goal: ensure the language thrives.

historical_context.significance: I whakatū te ture i Te Mātāwai, he tari tahi o te Karauna me te iwi Māori. He ture whakahirahira tēnei mō te whakaora i te reo.
